title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that a significant percentage of the population in this location is 15 to 29 years old.

Two points for explaining a reason why a significant percentage of the population in this location is 15 to 29 years old.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following reasons why the population shown in the pyramid might have this particular age structure:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the population shown in the pyramid might have this particular age structure:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the population shown in the pyramid might have this particular age structure:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating a cultural pull factor.

Two points for stating a cultural pull factor and describing why this factor might motivate a female migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following cultural pull factors that would motivate a female migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location:
The response correctly explains one of the following cultural pull factors that would motivate a female migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location:
The response correctly explains one of the following cultural pull factors that would motivate a female migrant from a rural area to move to an urban area in a very distant location:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that more women than men have moved to this location.

Two points for explaining a likely reason why more women than men have moved to this location.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following reasons why the female population aged 15 to 29 might be larger than the male population aged 15 to 29:
The response correctly explains one of the following reasons why the female population aged 15 to 29 might be larger than the male population aged 15 to 29:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the pyramid does not indicate the types of migration or whether migration is temporary or permanent.

Two points for explaining an additional type of data that would be required to indicate whether residents are temporary or permanent.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following limitations of the population pyramid in illustrating the spatial pattern of migration in this location:
The response correctly explains one of the following limitations of the population pyramid in illustrating the spatial pattern of migration in this location:
The response correctly explains one of the following limitations of the population pyramid in illustrating the spatial pattern of migration in this location:
